title: PGPD Implements Automated Speed Enforcement Program Within County School Zones
body:
Prince George’s County, Maryland…Prince George’s County will start the operation of its Automated Speed Enforcement Program on Monday, August 22, 2011, within designated county school zones. The Automated Speed Enforcement Program is intended to promote pedestrian safety, while deterring excessive speeding.  The program will use speed monitoring systems to photograph speed violations in the designated school zones.  Members of the media are encouraged to attend this event to assist in informing and educating drivers about this safety enforcement program.            Who:               Prince George’s County Police Department                                                                                                            When:              Thursday, August 18, 2011Time:               11:00 a.m. - 11:30 a.m.Where:             Issac Gourdine Middle School                         8700 Allentown Road                        Fort Washington, Maryland                         
Posted by


Prince George's County Police
